title: 107_hr970
content: The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to allocate $25,000,000 for fiscal year 2002 and subsequent years for the implementation of an Effective Prevention Program. Subparts and sections are redesignated accordingly. SEC. 4121. COMPREHENSIVE PREVENTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS. The Secretary is authorized to provide grants to States for implementing prevention programs meeting high scientific standards. States must submit a plan detailing grant selection criteria, ensuring funding for quality prevention programs, disseminating research-based materials, and providing technical assistance to local educational agencies. The Secretary will provide technical assistance to help local educational agencies implement prevention programs, evaluate their effectiveness, ensure compliance with requirements, and ensure that funds supplement other available resources. Additional criteria may be required by the Secretary. "SEC. 4122. RESERVATIONS AND ALLOCATIONS. The Secretary reserves and allocates funds among States for implementing programs under this subpart. If a State does not meet plan requirements, funds are reallocated to other States. Funds allocated must be used for program implementation. SEC. 4123. DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS." Each State educational agency receiving funds under this subpart must provide competitive grants to local educational agencies. Grants should prioritize agencies with demonstrated need, support startup costs for prevention plans, and ensure equitable distribution across different regions and school types. The State educational agency must provide competitive grants to local educational agencies, prioritizing those with demonstrated need and ensuring equitable distribution across different regions and school types. The agency may use up to 5 percent of funds for administrative expenses and to inform agencies about proven-effective prevention approaches. "SEC. 4124. LOCAL AWARDS." To be eligible for a subgrant, a local educational agency must submit an application and a plan demonstrating how it will meet program requirements. The grant funds must be used for implementing prevention programs based on reliable research, addressing various aspects of children's health, and providing developmentally appropriate interventions. The subgrant program requirements include addressing mental, emotional, social, and physical health of children, using developmentally appropriate activities, involving parents and professionals in planning, providing staff training, setting measurable goals, and utilizing external support for effective implementation. The subgrant program requirements involve providing staff training, setting measurable goals, utilizing external support, and coordinating resources to support comprehensive prevention efforts.
